1.title: Current Account Balance (3Y)
1.definition: Current account balance as percentage of gross domestic product (GDP) (three-year moving average, calculated according to international standards such as BPM6 and ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is +6% and -4%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448622950443.title: International Investment Position (A)
1448622950443.definition: Net international investment position as percentage of gross domestic product (GDP) (annual, calculated according to international standards such as BPM6 and ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is -35%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623066566.title: Real Effective Exchange Rate (3Y)
1448623066566.definition: Real effective exchange rate (HICP/CPI deflated, percentage change over three years relative to 41 other industrial countries). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is -/+5% for euro area countries. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623114676.title: Export Market Shares (5Y)
1448623114676.definition: Export market shares (measured in values, percentage change over five years, calculated according to international standards such as BPM6). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is -6%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623233385.title: Nominal Unit Labour Cost (3Y)
1448623233385.definition: Nominal unit labour cost (percentage change over three years, based on persons). Unit labour costs are a measure of total labour costs per unit of output, calculated as the ratio of compensation per employee to labour productivity (defined as GDP per person employed). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is +9% for euro area countries. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623431412.title: House Prices
1448623431412.definition: House prices relative to a Eurostat private consumption deflator (year-on-year percentage change, new and existing dwellings). The residential property price indicatorÂ for the euro area is an average of non-harmonised country indicators based on data from national sources. The coverage varies to some extent across countries. According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 6%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623524257.title: Private Sector Credit Flow
1448623524257.definition: Private sector credit flow as percentage of gross domestic product (GDP) (consolidated, calculated according to international standards such as BPM6 and ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 15%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623583187.title: Private Sector Debt
1448623583187.definition: Private sector debt as percentage of GDP (consolidated, calculated according to international standards such as BPM6 and ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 133%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623649199.title: General Government Sector Debt
1448623649199.definition: General government sector debt as percentage of gross domestic product (GDP) (calculated according to international standards such as BPM6 and ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 60%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623727896.title: Financial Sector Liabilities
1448623727896.definition: Total financial sector liabilities (year-on-year changes, non-consolidated, calculated according to international standards such as ESA 2010). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 16.5%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).

1448623789460.title: Unemployment Rate (3Y)
1448623789460.definition: Harmonised unemployment rate (three-year moving average). According to the Macroeconomic Imbalance Procedure (MIP) assessed by the European Commission, the indicative threshold for this indicator is 10%. Sources: ECB and European Commission (Eurostat and DG Economic and Financial Affairs).
